div.div: Need: To create emotionally rich and contextually appropriate music and video for digital media (e.g., games, films).
Difficulty: AI-generated audio or video lacks realism and emotional depth.
Immersive Experience
Need: To operate stably in complex real-world environments (e.g., with noise, occlusion).
Difficulty: The performance of multi-modal perception degrades sharply when information is degraded because the model cannot handle data outside of its training distribution.
System Robustness
Need: To protect users from inappropriate content generation and malicious guidance by AI.
Difficulty: Existing safety mechanisms are easily bypassed by adversarial attacks, posing ethical risks.
User Safety
Core Challenges
Generative AI: such as Diffusion models.
Multi-modal Large Language Models (LLMs): To perform generation, it is also necessary to understand how current technologies comprehend video and audio.
Affective Computing: For instance, generating corresponding audio and video for specific emotions mentioned in text to create an immersive atmosphere.
Speech and Audio Processing: These tools help us process audio more quickly and conveniently to achieve desired effects, such as speech and music generation technologies.
Key Technology Drivers
Game sound design
Film and television post-production
Media & Entertainment
Personalized learning companions
Interactive educational content
Generating realistic educational videos
Education
Providing environmental cues for visually or hearing-impaired individuals.
Assistive Technologies
Smart home assistants
Child companion robots
Consumer Robotics
Application Areas & Contexts
Children: Can learn from generated educational video content and experience a more immersive atmosphere suitable for their viewing and appreciation.
Designers or Advertising Professionals: Can complete the entire design process more efficiently, focusing their efforts on idea conception.
Entertainment, Education, and Tech Hardware Companies: Can produce content more efficiently to attract audiences in their respective fields.

Governments, Psychologists, Ethics Committees: Can collaborate with official bodies to create promotional materials or generate video and audio scenes with specific functions, such as for treating patients with depression.
Stakeholders
Sound Designers or Film Directors: The emergence of this technology could impact their income, as the skills they rely on for their livelihood may be replaced by AI.
Extreme Sports Bloggers: This technology allows for the generation of even more exaggerated videos, which could reduce the audience for their content.
The Elderly: May be susceptible to scams if they cannot distinguish between real and fake videos.
Negative Stakeholders
Develop more empathetic and trustworthy AI systems.
Promote the development of creative industries, education, and assistive technologies.
Shape the future of human-computer interaction.
Ultimate Goal & Impact
